description:
When the Majin awoke from the depths of darkness, the deity of fate chose six heroes and bequeathed them with the power to save the world. Adlet, a boy who proclaims himself the strongest on Earth, was selected among the Rokka no Yuusha (Heroes of the Six Flowers), and he goes to the rendezvous point — but seven have gathered there. The heroes suspect that someone among the seven is the enemy, and the initial suspicion falls on Adlet.

(Source: Anime News Network)
synonyms: ผู้กล้าแห่งบุปผา

tags.name: Survival
tags.description: Centers around the struggle to live in spite of extreme obstacles.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Fugitive
tags.description: Prominently features a character evading capture by an individual or organization.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Detective
tags.description: Features a character who investigates and solves crimes.

tags.name: Monster Girl
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

tags.name: Assassins
tags.description: Centers around characters who murder people as a profession.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

node.description: Light novel writer.
Originally an animator. Often works with [Hijiri Sanpei](https://anilist.co/staff/149565/).
Originating from [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/). He is a member of the Writers Guild of Japan.

[Website](http://www.michiru-oshima.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/OshimaMichiru) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/6zqZlqpjrq3op255dF32Fr?autoplay=true)

She is a composer who has worked on several video game, movie, and television titles. Her works include composition for the video games Ico for PlayStation 2, Arc the Lad III, and an orchestral arrangement of a Zelda medley for the Wii and Gamecube game The Legend of Zelda: Twilight Princess. In addition to video game music, she has composed music for the Godzilla movies and scores for numerous anime television series, including Fullmetal Alchemist (and the motion picure Fullmetal Alchemist the Movie: Conqueror of Shamballa), Queen Emeraldas and Bounen no Xamdou. She was also the composer for a Japanese stage musical adaptation of the classic Hollywood film Roman Holiday.

Ooshima graduated from the Kunitachi College of Music, Department of Music Composition. Afterwards she began her activities as a composer and arranger while in college, and has been involved in making music for movies, commercials, TV programs, animated features, and ambient music. While in college, she released a symphony entitled "Orasho". Through her masterful manipulation of both orchestras and synthesizers, she has attracted attention from various sectors for creating grandiose, dramatic sounds and beautiful melodies. Her awards include the Mainichi Film Contest Award for Best Music, and the 21st, 24th, 26th, 27th, 29th and 30th Japanese Academy Award for Music, and Jackson Hole Film Festival 2007(USA) Best Composer Award.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/miyagi_terui)

Alternative pen names: Hazuki Terui (照井葉月), Terui (テルイ)
Gender: female
Freelance Animator. Often seen working at [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/157173702)
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岩浪美和) | [Twitter](https://x.com/i/user/169097071)

Date of Birth: March 30, 1996 Birthplace: Okinawa City, Okinawa Prefecture, Japan Website | Twitter | Instagram Introduction Touyama Michiko (當山美智子), also known by her stage name MICHI (ミチ) is a Japanese singer under record label Pony Canyon. Biography Produced by Elements Garden, Michi began her career with her debut single, “Cry for the Truth/Secret Sky”, which served as the opening and ending theme songs to the anime television series Rokka: Braves of the Six Flowers. She has released two other singles of which her song "Checkmate!?" peaked at #51. This song was used as the opening song to Dagashi Kashi. Her third single, "Realistic!", was used as the first ending theme to the anime Kuromukuro. She released her first album called "Sprint for the Dreams" on September 21, 2016. Michi was a guest at the 2016 Anime Expo, and was a guest at Otakon 2016. Her song "I4U" was used as the ending theme to the 2017 anime television series Tsugumomo. Her song "Soranetarium" (ソラネタリウム) was used as the opening theme to the 2018 anime television series The Girl in Twilight. (Source: en.wikipedia.org)

__Height:__ 157 cm 

[Agency Profile](https://inari-inc.com/talent/yoko-hikasa/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/hikasayoko-official) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/hikasayoko_official/) | [Threads](https://www.threads.net/@hikasayoko_official) | [(Old) Twitter](https://twitter.com/hikasayokoSP)

Co-hosted the popular weekly radio show Odoroki Sentai Momonoki Five (おどろき戦隊モモノキファイブ) with fellow seiyuu [Eriko Nakamura](https://anilist.co/staff/103983) from 2009 to 2017.
She got married to a person from outside the industry in 2015.
On September 5, 2024, she announced that she was starting her own voice talent agency, [i.nari](https://inari-inc.com/), which would also be representing her going forward.

**Height:** 145 cm (4'9")
**Nicknames:** Ao-chan (あおちゃん), Kodomo sensei (こども先生, lit. Child teacher)
__Agency:__ Aoni Production

[Website (Columbia)](https://columbia.jp/yukiaoi) | [Website (FlyingDog)](https://www.jvcmusic.co.jp/flyingdog/-/Artist/A023992.html) | [Profile (Aoni Pro)](https://www.aoni.co.jp/search/yuki-aoi.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/staff_aoi/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/aoiyuki_official/) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aoi_Yūki) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/悠木碧)

Aoi Yabusaki, better known by her stage name Aoi Yuuki, is a Japanese actress, voice actress and singer represented by Pro-Fit.

Yuuki entered the entertainment industry at the age of four. As a child, she acted in films and dramas. From 1999 to 2002, she made regular appearances on the variety shows Appare Sanma Dai-sensei and Yappari Sanma Dai-sensei which aired on Fuji TV. When she was in fifth grade, she made her debut as a voice actress as [Sakura](https://anilist.co/character/15429/) on [Kino's Journey](https://anilist.co/anime/486/).

In late 2006, she was affiliated with the theater company Central. After her admission to high school in August 2007, she joined the agency Breath, whilst changing her stage name to Aoi Yuuki. In 2008, she got her first major role in [Kure-nai](https://anilist.co/anime/3358/) as [Murasaki Kuhouin](https://anilist.co/character/10174/). In August of the same year, she moved to the agency Pro-Fit.

In October 2011, she won the Newtype award for best lead voice actress for her role as [Madoka Kaname](https://anilist.co/character/37832/) in [Puella Magi Madoka Magica](https://anilist.co/anime/9756/). She was also awarded for Best Lead Actress in the 6th Seiyuu Awards for Madoka Kaname, [Victorique de Blois](https://anilist.co/character/20170/) and [Tooru Ichii](https://anilist.co/character/38904/).

In 2013, Yuuki and [Ayana Taketatsu](https://anilist.co/staff/101996/) formed the singing unit [petit milady](https://anilist.co/staff/116523).

**Non-anime voice roles:**

Renan Alonso is a Brazilian actor, voice actor, dubbing director, musical director, musician, and podcaster. He is married to the voice actress [Bruna Nogueira](https://anilist.co/staff/176954/) and son of [Gilberto de Syllos](https://anilist.co/staff/258936/).

He is an art director and supervisor, who was a long time member of Bihou until 2007 when he went to head the background art department in Totonyan. He belongs to the anime production group Neko-Nanban-Tei together with director Watanabe Takashi and his wife Miyata Naomi.
